intro: Pentagonocarpus hispidus, commonly known as the hairy pentagonocarpus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Meliaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive pentagonal-shaped fruits, which are a key botanical feature. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a rough, hairy texture, contributing to its common name. The species is notable for its ecological role in supporting various insect and bird species.
